abstract: Sheila C. Bair, the F.D.I.C.’s chairwoman, said that overhauling the nation’s mortgage-finance system “should rise to the top of the agenda” as soon as Congress completes its sweeping financial regulatory bill.
snippet: Sheila C. Bair, the F.D.I.C.’s chairwoman, said that overhauling the nation’s mortgage-finance system “should rise to the top of the agenda” as soon as Congress completes its sweeping financial regulatory bill.
lead_paragraph: Sheila C. Bair, the chairwoman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, said Friday that overhauling the nation’s mortgage-finance system “should rise to the top of the agenda” as soon as Congress completes its sweeping financial regulatory bill, Bloomberg News reports.

headline.main: Bair’s Next Target: Fannie and Freddie
